Max-Margin Early Event Detectors – version 0.1

By: Minh Hoai Nguyen (minhhoai@gmail.com)

Date: 3 June 2012

Prerequisite libraries:

Kevin Murphy’s HMM toolkit (For HMM and GMM): link

LibSVM (For normal binary SVMs): link

Cplex (For Quadratic Programming, Cplex is free for academic usage): link

VLFeat (For explicit approximate kernel): link

GSL CBLAS (for fast matrix operators) link

Compilation:

1. Go to the mmed-release-0.1/src/. Modify the Makefile to set appropriate PATHs for Vlfeat, Cplex, GSL Cblas. To compile, type:

> make

Compiled mex files are put in ./bin/

2. Compile LibSVM by going to the source directory and type:

> make

3. Open Matlab, change directory to: ./src/. Change the paths to HMMall and LibSVM, and run:

>> m_setup

Matlab might complaint about name conflict of assert. This is the problem of Kevin Murphy’s HMM. Just ignore it.

Run Matlab demos:

>> m_demo_synData (this should be very fast)

>> m_demo_asl (this will take around 15 minutes)

Source code

./src:

m_demo_synData.m: main function for experiments on synthetic data.

m_demo_asl.m: Australian sign language. comparing HMM-based and SVM-based detectors.

m_func_mu.m: compute the mu function, for slack variable rescaling.

m_getFd.m: get the dimension of feature vectors.

m_trnSegSVM.m: train binary segment-based SVM; this is not SO-SVM. Negative segments are sampled randomly. With appropriate setting, the truncated events are taken as positive samples too.

m_tstSegSVM.m: test segment-based SVM. This is not explicit to m_trnSegSVM. Any function based on segment uses this function to test

m_getSegFeatVec.m: get the segment feature vector

m_getRandSegFeatVecs.m: get feature vectors of random segments

m_hmmLogLik.m: log-likelihood for HMM

./src/kernel: Contains C code for several types of kernels and features.

m_mexInstantDetect_ker.cpp: training MMED and SOSVM with kernel

m_mexEval_ker.cpp: evaluating SVM-based detectors

m_mvc_ker.cpp m_mvc_ker.h: helper files for getting most violated constraints

./src/common: This directory contains code for evaluation.

m_event.h, m_event.cpp: helper files for Mex files of MMED

m_mexAMOC.cpp: compute the AMOC curve

m_mexCmpF1Score.cpp: compute F1 score

m_mexF1curve.cpp: compute F1 curve

m_mexF1curve_frm.cpp: compute F1 curve for frame-based detector

m_mexSampleSeg.cpp: Mex function for ordered sampling a segment.
